intro: Arenaria drypidea, commonly known as the sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Arenaria drypidea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
